Football.title: Fans convinced Champions League draw is ‚Äòrigged‚Äô as familiar fixture appears and Arsenal get easiest route to final
Football.content:
FANS have audaciously claimed the Champions League draw is rigged after Manchester City were picked out against Real Madrid yet again.

The two sides will meet in the Round of 16 after the Spanish giants beat Benfica in the play-off round.





The winner of that tie will likely have to face Bayern Munich in the quarter-final.

And then one of Liverpool, Chelsea, Paris Saint-Germain or Galatasaray will await in the semis.

Meanwhile, Arsenal have an easier route to the final, on paper at least, after being picked out on the other half of the draw.

Mikel Arteta‚Äòs side meet Bayer Leverkusen first.



They will the face Sporting or Bodo/Glimt, who defeated Serie A leaders Inter Milan in the play-offs.

The Gunners met the Norwegian in the Europa League as recently as 2022, winning 3-0 and 1-0.

Their toughest test may not come until the semi-final, when they could face Barcelona, Newcastle, Atletico Madrid or Tottenham in a North London Derby clash.

Some feel they have been given an easy draw while others feel the repeat of Man City v Real Madrid means the draw has been rigged.

Football.title: Neymar in heated confrontation with former rival ‚Äòtold me he will injure me again‚Äô ‚Äì ‚Äòlet‚Äôs see if he‚Äôs man enough‚Äô
Football.content:
NEYMAR has reignited a feud with an old rival after scoring twice against Vasco da Gama and being ‚Äòheadbutted.‚Äô

The Santos ace bagged both goals in a 2-1 win on Thursday night but that was overshadowed by his celebration and the fallout.





Neymar, 34, put his side ahead in the 25th minute before heading to the corner flag to dance like fellow Brazilian Vinicius Jr, who was racially abused by Benfica fans last week.

Vinicius also claimed that Benfica player Gianluca Prestianni had issued a racist slur during the game, bringing the match to a temporary halt and causing controversy in the football world.

After Neymar offered a gesture of support to Vini with his own samba jig, Vasco‚Äôs Thiago Mendes escalated matters.

The former Lyon midfielder confronted Neymar before kick-off and put his head towards the attacker.



With the referee already close by to try and stop matters from going any further, he had a perfect view of the incident as Neymar belatedly fell to the ground.

He appeared to have been headbutted, although contact looked minimal on replays.

Neymar went down to the ground clutching his face but both players were shown a yellow card.

Speaking afterwards, the former Paris Saint-Germain forward hadn‚Äôt forgotten a previous coming together with Mendes.

He said: ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs always him who wants to play tough.

‚ÄúWith all due respect, he‚Äôs an idiot.

‚ÄúHe‚Äôs already injured me once at PSG. Let‚Äôs see if he‚Äôs man enough to injure me again.‚Äù



Mendes left Neymar sidelined for over a month in December 2020 after a shocking tackle that saw him sent off whilst playing for Lyon.

PSG would lose the game 1-0 with Mendes seeing red in stoppage time and Neymar needing stretching off.

Now coming head-to-head (literally) again, the bad blood remains.

Mendes responded to Neymar‚Äôs comments, saying: ‚ÄúI only asked for a little respect.

‚ÄúHe told our supporters to be quiet during his celebration, and he demanded respect from me.



‚ÄúToday, everything revolved around Neymar.

‚ÄúThe referee only blew his whistle for him. At no point did he blow it for us.‚Äù

After the ankle injury over five years ago, Neymar‚Äôs dad wrote on Instagram: ‚ÄúF***‚Ä¶ how much longer?

‚ÄúWe have spoken about this so much, we have so underlined the excess of violence.

‚ÄúWe are not taking the necessary measures throughout the entire match, during which Neymar was the victim of a dozen fouls, always violent ones.



‚ÄúThis encourages these type of players and attitudes.‚Äù

Mendes and his family received death threats after suggestions that Neymar had broken his ankle.

The injury was not as bad as first feared but the bad blood certainly appears to remain.

Football.title: Champions League last 16 draw revealed as Arsenal handed dream route to final and Man City and Real Madrid clash again
Football.content:
ARSENAL, Chelsea, Liverpool, Manchester City, Tottenham and Newcastle have discovered their route to Champions League glory.

The draw for the last 16 was made in Nyon, Switzerland after eight sides progressed through the play-off round earlier this week.





And Arsenal have been handed a dream route as they look to bag their first Champions League crown.

The Gunners will take on Bayer Leverkusen in the last 16 and, should they progress, face the winners of the tie between Norwegian minnows Bodo/Glimt and Sporting in the quarter-finals.

Manchester City are desperate for revenge after being handed a showdown against Real Madrid.

Pep Guardiola‚Äôs side were knocked out of the competition by the LaLiga giants last season.



And Bayern Munich or Atalanta await in the next phase of Europe‚Äôs biggest club competition.

There could also be a mouth-watering all-Premier League clash in the quarter-finals.

Chelsea and Liverpool will meet for a place in the last four if they beat holders Paris Saint-Germain and Galatasaray respectively.



Newcastle overcame Qarabag in the play-off round to seal their place in Friday‚Äôs draw.

Eddie Howe‚Äôs charges will have to go toe-to-toe with Barcelona, having already lost to them in the league phase.

Marcus Rashford bagged a brace at St James‚Äô Park to leave the Magpies suffering a 2-1 loss last September.



If Newcastle manage to get their own back, they could come up against Tottenham for a place in the semi-finals.

Spurs, who are desperately trying to avoid a humiliating relegation to the Championship, will battle it out with Atletico Madrid.

The first leg of the last 16 ties will be played on March 9-11, with the return fixtures set for March 16-18.

The final is scheduled to be held at the Puskas Arena, in Budapest, on May 30.

Football.title: ‚ÄòThings got out of hand‚Äô ‚Äì Angel Di Maria blasts ex-Man Utd manager for picking on him and ‚Äòonly talking about mistakes‚Äô
Football.content:
ANGEL DI MARIA has blasted Louis van Gaal and claimed the Dutchman only ever criticised him at Manchester United while labelling his time at the club ‚Äús**t‚Äù.

The Argentina icon, 38, spent one season at Old Trafford in the 2014/15 campaign, joining in a shock ¬£60million move from Real Madrid.





However, Di Maria‚Äôs early sharp form quickly declined under Van Gaal‚Äôs management.

And he was turfed out just a year later to Paris Saint-Germain, having scored just four times in 32 United outings.

Now, Di Maria claims Van Gaal‚Äôs backroom style left him downcast during his time in Manchester.

The winger, currently playing for boyhood club Rosario Central, feels he was picked on more than other team-mates.



Di Maria reckons Van Gaal would constantly badger him over small mistakes, which he believes were inevitable as an attacker.

And the veteran‚Äôs claims have even been backed by former United team-mate Ander Herrera, who insists Van Gaal‚Äôs behaviour had a negative impact on Di Maria‚Äôs mindset.

Speaking in a preview of upcoming Netflix show ‚ÄòAngel Di Maria: Breaking Down the Wall‚Äô, Herrera said: ‚ÄúVan Gaal was the type of coach who was very critical when analysing his players‚Äô actions.

‚ÄúAnd I found it surprising that he considered it unacceptable for Angel to make three or four mistakes per game.‚Äù

The clip then showed Di Maria saying: ‚ÄúWe were winning, I was making assists and scoring, but he didn‚Äôt mention that.

‚ÄúHe only ever wanted to talk about the mistakes. Identifying and learning from your mistakes is crucial, of course.

‚ÄúBut given my position as a forward, I‚Äôm bound to make mistakes because I‚Äôm always trying.



‚ÄúMy job is to always go for an assist or take a shot on goal.‚Äù

Herrera next resumed, declaring: ‚ÄúIt reached a point where things just got out of hand.

‚ÄúCompared to everyone else on the team, it seemed like the coach was being way stricter with him.

‚ÄúEventually, I think all the criticism ended up undermining Angel‚Äôs confidence.‚Äù

Di Maria summed things up by adding: ‚ÄúI had sold more jerseys than anyone else upon my arrival to the Premier League, so I was finding myself under a lot of pressure. Really, that year was s***.‚Äù

Football.title: Captaincy options for Gameweek 26: Antoine Semenyo among strong candidates ahead of favourable double header
Football.content:
DREAM TEAM managers should think carefully about who to nominate as their captain for Gameweek 26.

With every club scheduled to play twice, there will be lots of points on offer and a smartly-selected skipper could make all the difference.



With that in mind, let‚Äôs analyse the strongest candidates.



As the runaway points leader and most popular player in the game, Erling Haaland (¬£7.2m) is always the first port of call.

Manchester City‚Äôs No9 has an appealing double header of Leeds (a) and Nottingham Forest (h), two teams fighting for survival.

A trip to Elland Road is a potential banana skin but Dream Team bosses will be expecting healthy returns from Pep Guardiola‚Äôs favourites this Gameweek.

Haaland has racked up 341 points via 29 goals and seven assists ‚Äî obscene numbers.

However, it‚Äôs worth noting that Antoine Semenyo (¬£4.9m) has outscored the Norway poacher since the pair became team-mates in January.

The ex-Bournemouth averages 10.7 points-per-Gameweek since his move to the Etihad in a fruitful run that has features five goals and three assists.

Betting against Haaland requires a certain degree of courage but there is enough evidence to justify captaining Semenyo at this stage of the campaign.



Elsewhere, Liverpool‚Äôs double of West Ham (h) and Wolves (a) is similarly enticing.

The Reds‚Äô upcoming opponents have conceded 100 league goals between them this season and so Hugo Ekitike (¬£4.5m) has to be worthy of serious consideration.

The Frenchman hasn‚Äôt earned many points in his last four outings but he remains the club‚Äôs top scorer this campaign with 14 goals.

That being said, Dominik Szoboszlai (¬£5.5m) is Liverpool‚Äôs best performer in terms of points and that‚Äôs what really matters at the end of the day.

In fact, only the aforementioned Haaland has more points to his name after 25 Gameweeks.



A rare double header for Manchester United brings their top stars into the captaincy conversation.

Bruno Fernandes (¬£6.6m) boasts a mighty points-per-game average of 7.3 (only bettered by Haaland) and so it would reasonable to expect a satisfying double-digit haul from him in Gameweek 26.

The Red Devils are due to host Crystal Palace on Sunday in what is a favourable match-up on current form.

The Eagles may still be feeling the effects of Thursday night‚Äôs Conference League play-off second leg against Zrinjski.



Michael Carrick‚Äôs troops will then travel to St James‚Äô Park to take on Newcastle on Wednesday night, a tougher prospect but nothing to be overly cautious of given the Magpies have lost four of their last five league games.

Football.title: ‚ÄòHe‚Äôs a millionaire but it doesn‚Äôt give you extra lung‚Äô ‚Äì Cole Palmer burnout fears as he faces 3 summers without break
Football.content:
PFA boss Maheta Molango fears Cole Palmer risks being burned out by the demands on him.

England ace Palmer was the star of Chelsea‚Äôs Club World Cup triumph last summer.





But the attacking midfielder, 23, has missed more than half of Chelsea‚Äôs 42 games this season after a series of injuries.

He has only been available for one of Thomas Tuchel‚Äôs 10 games as England boss, the 1-0 summer win over Andorra.

And while Palmer returned to goal scoring form with a hat-trick at Wolves and eighth Prem goal of the campaign in the home draw with Leeds, Molanga admitted he is really concerned about the impact of so much football.

The PFA boss, speaking at the Financial Times Business of Football Summit, said: ‚ÄúThe concern is of course player welfare.



‚ÄúWhen I look at someone like Cole Palmer, if he goes to the World Cup that‚Äôs three consecutive summers without a break.

‚ÄúPeople say he‚Äôs a millionaire. Yes, he is

‚ÄúBut it doesn‚Äôt give you an extra lung or an extra leg.

‚ÄúI want to see Cole Palmer on the pitch because he‚Äôs the one who makes me dream.



BEST FREE BETS AND BETTING SIGN UP OFFERS

‚ÄúBut the reality is that the fans pay right now 100 per cent of the ticket price and a lot of time they get 70 per cent, if they‚Äôre lucky, of the show because players start regulating themselves and it‚Äôs not good.

‚ÄúChristmas is nice because it‚Äôs not every Tuesday.

‚ÄúWe need to discover that ‚Äì because we thought in football that more is more and, actually, sometimes less is more.‚Äù

Molango added: ‚ÄúThe problem is that each competition organiser just looks at their competition in isolation and the problem is that they don‚Äôt talk to each other.



‚ÄúIn which sensible head does it fit that you can have someone playing the Champions League on the 31st of May within four days then go for a 10-day window with the national team.

‚ÄúAnd then within four days be expected to be in the US to play the Club World Cup that finishes on the 14th of July to then be back within two weeks for training.

‚ÄúI was at the training camp of Chelsea at the start of the season.

‚ÄúWhen they came back they were shattered. This is just the reality.

‚ÄúIs this what we wanted as an industry? I‚Äôm not sure. Sometimes we need to be honest with ourselves and understand that sometimes less is more.‚Äù

Football.title: Premier League stadium left trashed by away fans with dozens of seats ripped out after Europa League clash
Football.content:

Forest punched their ticket to the last 16 despite losing 2-1 to Fener at the City Ground thanks to their 3-0 victory in last week‚Äôs first leg at Sukru Saracoglu Stadium.





But photos emerged after the game showing the away section in an absolute mess.

Seats appear to have been ripped out with some trash left behind after the game.



This comes after a heated encounter in Nottingham that had to be suspended just after kick-off.

Referee Maurizio Mariani was forced to pause the match after just one minute.

That was because Fenerbahce fans began throwing objects on the pitch.

Flares were also chucked on the ground, which led to a rather lengthy pause.



Players were forced to kick the flares off the pitch in front of the Bridgford Stand.

Football.title: Arne Slot pinpoints biggest difference in Mo Salah performances during Liverpool drought
Football.content:
Arne Slot pinpoints biggest difference in Mo Salah performances during Liverpool drought

Mohamed Salah has failed to score in his last nine Premier League games but Arne Slot believes the Egypt superstar will soon be back to his best in front of goal

View 2 Images Arne Slot insists it is only a matter of time before Mohamed Salah starts scoring again (Image: Getty Images)

Arne Slot insists he isn't concerned by the fact that Mohamed Salah is in the midst of his longest Premier League goal drought since joining Liverpool - because the attacker 'always scores in the end'.

‚Äå



The Reds talisman hasn't found the net in the league since scoring in the 2-0 win over Aston Villa back in November, a run of nine games either side of Salah's commitments with Egypt at the Africa Cup of Nations.

‚Äå



Salah, Liverpool's all-time leading goalscorer in the Premier League, has never gone that long without scoring a league goal since moving to Anfield in 2017.

‚Äå



And Slot, who dropped the Egypt star from his starting XI earlier in the season, says the only reason Salah's current barren run is being scrutinised is because of how consistently excellent he has been for the champions. "He set his own standards and those are so, so, so high and the moment he doesn't score for a few games people are immediately surprised - that is the biggest compliment he can get," the Dutchman said on Friday.

"With data you can use it to your advantage or disadvantage but not to use the FA Cup game - if we play a Premier League side - you could argue if that is fair. But that's the way it works: if we want to highlight something really positive we try to forget one or two games and if we want to highlight something negative we can try to forget one or two games as well.

‚Äå



"Three games ago he had an assist and a goal against a very good Premier League team Brighton, so that is the reality, and then you can change data and say he did not score in nine Premier League games. That is the standard he sets for himself and that is why people are surprised when things like that happen."

While Salah has struggled to replicate the sensational form that helped fire Liverpool to Premier League glory last year, Slot pointed out that he is far from the only attacker struggling to find the back of the net consistently.

View 2 Images Salah, like Liverpool, has endured a challenging campaign (Image: Getty Images)

‚Äå



He continued: "We are used to Mo scoring a lot of goals and at this moment in time that is maybe the biggest difference in his performance and game time. But we also know this has happened before, I don't know if it happened nine games in a row but I've had these questions earlier if didn't score for three or five but I know in the end he always starts scoring again. That is the challenge he has and we have now to make sure he starts scoring again.

"He is not our only attacker at this moment in time that doesn't score as much as we are used to. The focus is totally on him because of everything he did for the club but Hugo [Ekitike] and Cody [Gakpo] haven't scored that many goals recently as well.

"It is a team thing which we have to improve. The good thing is we keep clean sheets so they don't need to score as many, although against Qarabag we scored six and scored four against Newcastle."

Football.title: Premier League's TV revolution signalling end of 3pm blackout would be no bad thing
Football.content:
Premier League's TV revolution signalling end of 3pm blackout would be no bad thing

New streaming agreement with Singapore could be a sign of how the future of televised football in the United Kingdom will look when the current deal ends in three years' time

View 4 Images Richard Masters and the Premier League have signed a new TV agreement with a broadcaster in Singapore (Image: Carl Recine/Getty Images)

The news that the Premier League is going ‚Äòdirect-to-consumer‚Äô in one of its international broadcast markets should come as no surprise. Make no mistake, the ‚ÄòPremflix‚Äô TV channel is coming to you, sooner or later.

‚Äå



It might be as early as 2029, when the current ¬£6.7billion domestic deal with Sky Sports and TNT Sports comes to an end. But whenever ‚ÄòPremflix‚Äô hits our screens, one of the first questions that will be asked is ‚Ä¶ what took them so long?

‚Äå



The streaming arrangement with Singapore company StarHub means all 380 games will be shown live on a special channel, Premier League +. The channel will also have magazine content.

‚Äå

‚ÄúWe have now taken control of our content. It allows us to look differently in the future,‚Äù Richard Masters, the Premier League‚Äôs chief executive, told the FT Live Business of Football summit.

And it does not take a leap of imagination to envisage how ‚Äòdifferently‚Äô televised Premier League football in the United Kingdom will look in the not-too-distant future. The organisation‚Äôs own streaming service might run alongside a TV deal with Sky, or whoever, but you can be almost certain of one thing.

‚Äå



We will not go into the next decade with an arrangement that means not every Premier League game is available to watch as it happens. The Americans who own Premier League clubs will surely see to that.

View 4 Images The Premier League's current domestic TV deal is up for renewal in 2029 (Image: George Wood/Getty Images)

View 4 Images Sky Sports is the main broadcaster of the Premier League but can only show a limited number of matches live (Image: PA)

‚Äå



Fundamentally, it is an insult to the passion and commitment of fans of clubs throughout the entire football pyramid to suggest they would not go and support their team if Bournemouth v Brentford was being shown on the telly at the same time. And with respect to those two teams, it would, generally, be Bournemouth v Brentford, or sides of a similar ilk.

The big TV guns - Manchester United, Liverpool, Arsenal - are needed for prime time as it stands right now. You can see a point in the future when they never play at 3pm on a Saturday. It would be another mighty blow to the tradition and history of football on these shores but since when has that been a concern of Premier League club owners?

View 4 Images Richard Masters has given no indication of the 3pm blackout being up for discussion (Image: Sky Sports/NBC Sports)

‚Äå



They are, as a rule, successful business people and, whether you like it or not, they have a product that is in phenomenal demand at home and abroad. For elements of that product to be unavailable to watch live is a glaring anomaly in 21st century sports broadcasting.

And don‚Äôt worry about the clubs in the Championship, in Leagues One and Two, in the National League and in all the leagues below. Their loyalty will not even be remotely tested by Bournemouth v Brentford on Premflix at 3pm on a Saturday.

Football.title: Champions League last-16 draw in full as Arsenal, Liverpool and Man City discover opponents
Football.content:
Manchester City are set to meet Real Madrid in the Champions League yet again after the last-16 draw was completed on Friday. The draw took place in Nyon after the completion of the playoffs earlier this week.

And having clashed on a number of occasions over the past few seasons, Guardiola will take on his former foes once more. Chelsea in the meantime have been given a tough test against reigning champions Paris Saint-Germain.

Liverpool will take on Turkish side Galatsaray, while Arsenal are set for a clash with German side Bayer Leverkusen.

Tottenham and Newcastle have been handed Spanish opponents in the last 16. Eddie Howe's men will take on Barcelona, while Tottenham are due to face Atletico Madrid.

The first-leg fixtures for the last 16 will take place across the 10 and 11 March, with the return legs scheduled for the following week. While clubs now know who they will take on in the last 16, all of the clubs remaining in the Champions League have also discovered their potential opponents for the remainder of the campaign, with the bracket having also been decided.

Arsenal sealed their spot in the last 16 of the competition automatically, having finished top of the initial league stage, with eight wins from eight. They were closely followed by reigning Premier League champions Liverpool, who secured 18 points and finished third.

Tottenham were one point and place further behind. Chelsea and Manchester City also sealed an automatic spot in the next round of the competition, having also finished in the top eight.

Newcastle United had some work to do to seal their place in the last-16, having only managed to secure a playoff spot. But they eased through relatively simply after a straight-forward win against Qarabag.

Football.title: Viktor Gyokeres could force Arsenal to make immediate payout after Chelsea game
Football.content:
Viktor Gyokeres could force Arsenal to make immediate payout after Chelsea game

Viktor Gyokeres has already triggered a number of add-ons in his Arsenal contract, with the Gunners potentially set to pay Sporting CP another sum in the near future

View 2 Images Viktor Gyokeres joined Arsenal from Sporting CP last summer (Image: David Price/Arsenal FC via Getty Images)

Viktor Gyokeres could net Sporting CP over ¬£400,000 this weekend if the Arsenal forward scores or sets up three goals against Chelsea on Sunday.

‚Äå



As part of the bonuses negotiated when securing the Sweden international last summer, his former club are owed ¬£437,000 for every 20-goal contribution, according to The Sun. After netting twice against Tottenham Hotspur in the north London derby, Gyokeres has reached 15 goals and two assists across all competitions.

‚Äå



A hat-trick at the Emirates Stadium on Sunday, or three goal contributions, would trigger the milestone, although it would require an exceptional display. The most goals Gyokeres has contributed in a single fixture this season are two.

‚Äå



Gyokeres has, however, achieved this six times this term, one of which was against Chelsea in the Carabao Cup semi-final first leg.

Gyokeres netted Arsenal's second and teed up Martin Zubimendi for their third in the 3-2 away victory.

That marked the first match he found the back of the net and provided an assist for a team-mate's goal.

‚Äå



The only other instance arrived a fortnight later, during another 3-2 triumph, this time against Kairat in their final fixture of the Champions League's league phase.

Sunday's victory over Spurs marked his fourth double, with the others arriving against Atletico Madrid, Leeds United and Sunderland. Gyokeres' strikes, however, will cost Arsenal no more than ¬£874,000 additional funds, as there is only one further instalment linked to his scoring should the forward manage to reach 40 goals and assists.

‚Äå



Appearances, though, are an element Arsenal have already needed to supplement the initial sum they paid Sporting. They are reported to have paid out ¬£1.1million after Gyokeres made his 20th appearance that lasted at least a complete half - 45 minutes - which was the 3-2 triumph over Bournemouth.

Sporting will continue to collect that sum after every 20 appearances that satisfy the minutes-based requirements, up to No. 80.

At that stage, they will have banked ¬£4.4million in total from their former frontman representing Arsenal.

‚Äå



View 2 Images Viktor Gyokeres has scored 15 goals so far this season for Arsenal (Image: Marc Atkins/Getty Images)

Gyokeres has reached 30 following the north London derby, so another payment could materialise before the conclusion of this campaign if he remains fully fit.

Sporting will also be anticipating the ¬£874,000 they are owed from the Gunners upon securing next season's Champions League qualification. They are set to collect that figure each time Arsenal qualify, until it totals ¬£3.5million, for a sum of four instalments.

Football.title: Managing Barcelona as Marcus Rashford agreement reached and Harry Kane reacts to transfer link
Football.content:
Managing Barcelona as Marcus Rashford agreement reached and Harry Kane reacts to transfer link

Marcus Rashford and Harry Kane have both been linked with summer moves to Barcelona

View 4 Images Barcelona boss Hansi Flick has some thinking to do amid links to both Marcus Rashford and Harry Kane (Image: Europa Press via Getty Images)

Barcelona could have a distinctly English flavour next season, with both Marcus Rashford and Harry Kane linked with moves to the Camp Nou. Rashford, currently on loan at the Spanish giants from Manchester United, is pushing for a permanent transfer, while Kane's club future remains uncertain, with his Bayern Munich contract set to expire in just over a year.

‚Äå



The prospect of both England internationals ending up in Catalonia isn't out of the question, leaving Barcelona boss Hansi Flick with some big decisions to make in terms of squad planning this summer.

‚Äå



Rashford has made it clear that he wants to stay at Barcelona beyond the end of the season - and he looks increasingly likely to get his wish. The La Liga giants have reportedly pledged to pay the ¬£26million buyout clause in Rashford's contract, a figure United are unwilling to reduce .

‚Äå



Over recent months, the two clubs have explored terms to make a permanent deal possible, following Rashford's impressive start in Spain. The 28-year-old has notched 10 goals and 13 assists in 34 games this season, leaving Barcelona delighted with his performances.

MAKE THE MIRROR YOUR FIRST CHOICE! Click here to activate or add us as Preferred Source in your Google search settings

Barcelona chief offers clear Julian Alvarez update amid Arsenal interest READ MORE :

Marcus Rashford's Barcelona dream transfer at risk as Premier League return twist tipped READ MORE :

In a recent interview with SPORT, Rashford said: "Of course, what I want is to stay at Barca. It's an end goal, but it's not the reason why I'm training hard and giving it my best.

‚Äå



"I'm in the perfect place and environment to continue my journey as a football player, so I just try to do my best every day and help the team win. We'll see what happens next summer.

"I'm adapting very well to the club and the city. From the moment I arrived I felt that everyone welcomed me very well. For me, the reason I'm here is to help the team win trophies."

View 4 Images Marcus Rashford is pushing for a permanent move to Barcelona (Image: Angel Martinez, Getty Images)

‚Äå



With Ruben Amorim - previously a source of Rashford's dissatisfaction at United - now gone, there had been speculation that he might return to Old Trafford after his loan. However, a permanent move to Barcelona now looks most likely.

As for Kane, his long-term future is increasingly unclear. By the end of the season, he will have just 12 months remaining on his Bayern contract - the same situation that forced Tottenham to sell the striker in 2023, to avoid losing him for free a year later.

Barcelona have emerged as a potential destination for the England captain, particularly with star striker Robert Lewandowski approaching his 38th birthday and the end of his Camp Nou contract, which expires at the end of the season. The Poland international is still scoring goals, but Barcelona are now facing a 'stick or twist' moment regarding his future.

‚Äå



View 4 Images Harry Kane's Bayern contract expires in 2027 (Image: Leonhard Simon/Getty Images)

If Barcelona allow Lewandowski's contract to expire, they will need a proven, ready-made replacement - and Kane fits the profile perfectly, having consistently scored goals in both England and Germany.

However, if a deal for Kane cannot be secured this summer, the club might consider offering Lewandowski a last-minute contract extension. After all, Kane recently downplayed speculation about a move, insisting he is "very happy" in Bavaria.

‚Äå



"I haven't heard anything about it," Kane said when asked about links to Barca. "My father and brother handle everything, but they haven't said anything to me. As I've already said, I'm very happy here at Bayern. I'm focused on this season and my time at Bayern. I take it as a compliment."

View 4 Images Barcelona need to find a strong replacement for Robert Lewandowski if the Pole leaves this summer (Image: Fadel SENNA/AFP via Getty Images)

Kane has been in sensational form this season, netting an incredible 43 goals in 36 games. Talks over a contract extension are reportedly ongoing, but if Bayern falter, Barcelona could move in to snap the 32-year-old up.

Article continues below

A move to the Camp Nou would make Kane just the third Englishman to play for the Blaugrana in the last century. Rashford became the second earlier this season, following Gary Lineker, who scored 52 goals in 138 appearances between 1986 and 1989.

Beyond Kane, Barcelona are also linked with Atletico Madrid forward Julian Alvarez. The former Manchester City star, who scored 29 goals in all competitions last season, is reportedly open to a move. However, prying him away from Atleti will be costly, with reports suggesting it could take a bid exceeding ¬£80m to convince the Madrid club to sell.

Football.title: Marcus Rashford's chances of Man Utd return summed up by Michael Carrick warning
Football.content:
Marcus Rashford's chances of Man Utd return summed up by Michael Carrick warning

Marcus Rashford burst onto the scene for Manchester United in 2016

View 3 Images (Image: Laurence Griffiths, Getty Images)

Michael Carrick's praise of Marcus Rashford's debut for Manchester United demonstrates just how impressed he was by the academy prospect. The current interim boss was still in the first team when Rashford exploded onto the scene as a teenager.

‚Äå



The then-18-year-old made his first appearance under Louis van Gaal in the Europa League. He was handed the start after striker Anthony Martial sustained an injury in the warm-up before facing FC Midtjylland.

‚Äå



Rashford scored twice to secure United's last-16 place and establish his status as one of United's newest stars. After he netted two and set up the third in a 3-2 victory over Arsenal in the Premier League just three days later, people really saw his potential.

‚Äå



It was at this point that Carrick offered the young Rashford some sound but firm advice. He said: "Watch yourself now. Enjoy it but you're going to get a lot of media attention; everyone's going to know you.

Man Utd‚Äôs debt rises AGAIN as worrying numbers paint grim picture for Sir Jim Ratcliffe READ MORE :

"You've gone from no one knowing who you are to a potential superstar."

‚Äå



These words proved significant as Rashford would go on to become one of the first names on the teamsheet and a modern club legend. The forward has made 426 appearances for the club, netting 138 goals and providing 79 assists.

View 3 Images The interim boss may consider bringing Rashford back (Image: OLI SCARFF, AFP via Getty Images)

However, after a public spat with former manager Ruben Amorim and a significant drop in form, Rashford was loaned out to Aston Villa before making a temporary switch to Barcelona this season.

‚Äå



His contract at the Spanish club includes a ¬£26million option to buy, which they are reportedly considering activating in the summer. The 27-year-old has made a strong impression at Barca, contributing to 23 goals in 34 appearances.

Carrick's comments could indicate a potential return for Rashford at United, as the interim boss clearly holds the forward in high regard. Despite all indications pointing towards a permanent departure, former teammate Juan Mata believes his childhood affection for the club could outweigh all the challenges Rashford has encountered.

He said: "It's not easy to handle with all the expectations and the pressure at the club like Man United but I think people will realise that he was a kid and he was a man who gave everything for the club he supported since he was a kid.

‚Äå



View 3 Images However, Barcelona are keen to keep the English forward (Image: Judit Cartiel, Getty Images)

"You can see photos of him when he was almost a baby with a Man United shirt on. So it meant a lot for him to play for Man United. You could see that.

"I think he gave great moments and great memories for many fans. Of course, there were also some challenging times but I think they made him more mature and a stronger man.

‚Äå

"There are always challenges and he had that at the club. But he's now in a new chapter.

"He went to Barcelona, which is one of the best teams in the world and he's performing there. He's showing his level. I'm very happy for him that he's able to try and prove his level in different countries."

Football.title: Jeremy Jacquet injury update after Liverpool signing suffered 'serious' blow
Football.content:
Jeremy Jacquet injury update after Liverpool signing suffered 'serious' blow

Liverpool signing Jeremy Jacquet remains sidelined with a shoulder injury as Rennes manager Franck Haise confirms the defender is still receiving treatment

View 2 Images Jeremy Jacquet will join Liverpool from Rennes in the summer (Image: Neal Simpson/Sportsphoto/Allstar via Getty Images)

Liverpool have received a fresh fitness update regarding new signing Jeremy Jacquet. The Reds secured an agreement during the January transfer window to sign the Rennes centre-back in a deal valued at ¬£60million, including ¬£5m in add-ons.

‚Äå



Jacquet will formally move to Anfield in the summer following the end of the current campaign. The defender sustained an injury mere days after finalising his move to become a Liverpool player, though.

‚Äå



The 20-year-old picked up what seemed to be a shoulder injury on February 7 during Rennes' 3-0 loss to Lens in Ligue 1, which was described as "serious" by the club's former boss Habib Beye.

‚Äå



"We'll have time to see, but it's definitely quite serious for both of them," Beye told reporters at the time. "For Jeremy, it's his shoulder, and for Abdelhamid [Ait Boudlal] it's muscular."

Arne Slot shares concerning Florian Wirtz injury update with star out of West Ham clash READ MORE :

Now, nearly three weeks following the injury, an update on Jacquet's injury has emerged from Rennes' new manager, Franck Haise, who has confirmed the defender will miss his side's fixture against Toulouse this weekend, reports the Liverpool Echo.

FOLLOW OUR LIVERPOOL FB PAGE! Latest Reds news and more on our dedicated Facebook page

‚Äå



‚ÄúI don't know exactly yet, he (Jacquet) is receiving treatment and rehabilitation, that's where we are at the moment, he's working in the gym," Haise stated on Thursday, via L‚ÄôEquipe.

It remains uncertain how long Jacquet will be unavailable with his present injury and whether he will represent Rennes again before departing the club at season's end to join Liverpool.

At the beginning of this month, Arne Slot was quizzed about Jacquet, with the Liverpool manager stating: ‚ÄúVery pleasing, of course, because first of all he is a very big talent ‚Äì and maybe even more than ‚Äòonly‚Äô a talent, but we speak about talent because of his age, of course.

‚Äå



View 2 Images Jeremy Jacquet suffered a shoulder injury earlier this month (Image: Emilian Baldow/Icon Sport via Getty Images)

‚ÄúSecond of all because we weren‚Äôt the only one interested in him, so another big compliment for the people that are working every single day so hard to sign players, that we were able to sign such a big talent.

‚ÄúAnd [it is] another example of the model we are using at this club: so, young, very talented players, sometimes in the start of their career, sometimes already a little bit a few years into their career, but always players that are young and can improve us and help us for the short, but definitely also for the long term.

Article continues below

‚ÄúWe have signed a lot of them recently and I‚Äôve said many times that the mid- to long-term, but even the short-term, future of this club is in a very, very, very good place.‚Äù

Cheltenham Festival 2026 VIP and hospitality tickets are in high demand as the four-day racing event nears.

The Cheltenham Festival 2026 is fast approaching and tickets are flying off the shelves. Between March 10 and March 13, thousands of racing enthusiasts will flock to the legendary Cheltenham Racecourse.

For those wanting to splash out, VIP and hospitality packages remain on sale, featuring complimentary food and beverages alongside outstanding views of the racing. These premium experiences are available through Seat Unique, though only 'limited availability' remains.

Packages can still be secured for every day of the four-day meeting, including Champion Day, Ladies Day, St Patrick's Thursday and Gold Cup Day. General admission passes are also on sale via The Jockey Club, with various ticketing options available across all four days of racing, reports the Manchester Evening News.

Football.title: Man City draw Real in CL last 16 as Chelsea face holders PSG
Football.content:
Manchester City will face Real Madrid in the last 16 of the Champions League, as Chelsea were drawn against holders Paris Saint-Germain.

It means Man City and 15-time winners Real Madrid have been drawn in the Champions League knockouts for a fifth consecutive season.

Chelsea could have been handed an all-English last-16 tie against Newcastle, but Eddie Howe's side will face Spanish champions Barcelona.

Premier League leaders Arsenal, who topped the Champions League table with a perfect record, will face German side Bayer Leverkusen.

Six-time winners Liverpool will take on Galatasaray, while Tottenham have been handed a tie against Atletico Madrid.

The last-16 first legs take place on March 10 and 11, with the second legs scheduled for March 17 and 18.

More to follow...

Home advantage in second legs for seeded teams

The top eight teams from the league phase are seeded and will have home advantage in the second leg of their round of 16 games.

This will extend to the quarter-finals for the teams that finished in the top four of the league phase - Arsenal, Bayern, Liverpool and Spurs - if they progress.

For Arsenal and Bayern, the top two, they will also have home advantage in the second leg of their semi-final if successful.

Any team that eliminates a seeded team will take their privileges.

When will fixture dates be announced?

The round of 16 match schedule will be available on Friday evening.

The quarter-final match schedule will be confirmed on March 19, while the semi-final schedule will be communicated on April 16.

When are the 2025/26 Champions League knockout stages?

Round of 16: March 10-11 and 17-18

Quarter-finals: April 7-8 and 14-15

Semi-finals: April 28-29 and May 5-6

Final: Saturday May 30

Where is the Champions League final?

The 2025/26 Champions League final will take place in Budapest at the Puskas Arena on Saturday May 30.

Significant regulation changes will see a new era of F1 begin at the Australian Grand Prix where a new pecking order will begin to form and a different style of racing which the drivers will need to adjust to.

Pre-season testing suggested no team will dominate with Mercedes and Ferrari expected to contend for the first win of 2026.

It means George Russell and Kimi Antonelli are among the favourites for victory in Melbourne, along with Charles Leclerc and Lewis Hamilton - particularly if Ferrari replicate their rocketship starts from Bahrain testing.

The best places to overtake are at Turns 3 and 11 but that may change with the new expected style of racing due to the 2026 F1 regulation changes where energy deployment will be critical.

Football.title: Pavan sustains multiple injuries after falling down lift shaft in freak accident
Football.content:
Italian golfer Andrea Pavan has sustained multiple injuries after falling three floors down a lift shaft in South Africa.

The accident took place at Pavan's lodging in Stellenbosch ahead of the South African Open, with Pavan falling when the lift doors opened but there was no lift car in the shaft, according to a GoFundMe page set up by former team-mate Matt van Zandt.

Pavan - a two-time DP World Tour winner - was rushed to the local hospital, where he was confirmed to have significant injuries to his shoulder and back, including severe shoulder damage and fractures to several vertebrae.

Image: Andrea Pavan is a two-time winner on the DP World Tour

Pavan has already undergone at least one major surgery and is expected to remain in hospital in South Africa, where he will receive continued medical care before being evaluated for travel back to the United States.

The fundraiser, set up to support his wife Audra and their three children with medical bills, has seen professional golfers donating, including Richard Mansell, Nacho Elvira and Jhonattan Vegas.

Pavan's former college coach JT Higgins told Golf Channel: "By all accounts, he's in good spirits, thankful to be alive and FaceTiming with his kids."

Football.title: Rhodes stays in hunt, two off lead at Women's World Championship
Football.content:
England's Mimi Rhodes remains two shots off leader Auston Kim after the second round of the HSBC Women's World Championship in Singapore.

Rhodes followed up Thursday's bogey-less 68 with a three-under 69 on Friday, carding four birdies and a lone bogey on the fourth hole, leaving her in a four-way tie for fifth at the halfway stage.

Although Kim suffered a double-bogey on the 16th hole to mitigate her five birdies earlier in her second round of 69, the American improved to nine under for the tournament to maintain her lead..

Image: Minjee Lee of Australia had an eagle and six birdies to tie for the round of the day on Friday (AP Photo/Suhaimi Abdullah)

Three-time major winner Minjee Lee improved on her first-round score by eight strokes on Friday for an eight-under 64 to move into a tie for second place.

The No 4-ranked Lee, one of nine top-10 LPGA Tour players in the field in Singapore this week, had an eagle and six birdies to see her tie the round of the day at the Sentosa Golf Club's Tanjong course.

Lee is tied for second alongside Ariya Jutanugarn (67) and Haeran Ryu (68).

Hannah Green finished with three birdies in a row for a 66 d to move into a tie for fifth, while Angel Yin matched Lee's 64 to sit six under, three behind Kim.

Please use Chrome browser for a more accessible video player The Sky Sports Golf podcast discuss how important 2026 will be for Charley Hull's career

World No 3, England's Charley Hull, posted a 67 on Friday, with six birdies and one bogey, to move her to five under after posting a 72 in the first round with three bogeys.

Defending champion Lydia Ko had a 72 after a challenging round that saw her end with four birdies and four bogeys to sit two under with just two rounds remaining.

World No 1 Jeeno Thitikul, who won last week's tournament in her native Thailand, shot 70 after an opening 73 that has her one under, eight off the lead.

The tournament is the second of three stops as part of the LPGA's early‚Äëseason Asian swing, with the final event taking place next week on Hainan Island, China.

Football.title: 'Nothing will distract him' - Brundle on 'ready' Russell's title chances
Football.content:
George Russell is "ready" to fight for a first F1 world championship in the 2026 season, says Sky Sports F1's Martin Brundle.

As the countdown continues to next week's season-opening Australian Grand Prix, live on Sky Sports, Mercedes' Russell remains the bookmakers' favourite for the Drivers' Championship with the Silver Arrows having enjoyed a strong pre-season with their new W17 car.

Brundle believes there is "not a clear favourite" for the title as it stands based on the picture from testing, but Russell is among those set to fight for the crown if pre-season expectations prove accurate.

"I do think he's ready for it," says Brundle of the 28-year-old Russell, who is entering his eighth season of F1.

"He's a smart guy; they're all smart guys. George has got the team around him. Kimi [Antonelli] will be stronger this year in the other car, but George is completely out of Lewis [Hamilton]'s shadow there, he's the king of the castle at Mercedes-Benz.

"He did all those years at Williams and then he went to Mercedes when they just stopped dominating, so he's done the hard yards.

"I think he's got the experience, he's got the car control, and I think he will command the respect in the team to help drive what's going to be an incredibly changeable year."

Please use Chrome browser for a more accessible video player Craig Slater and Martin Brundle review and rank all the F1 teams after pre-season testing

Speaking during an appearance on Sky Sports News, Brundle added: "I think his team-mate Kimi Antonelli will have a great season as well, but George has got all the confidence he needs to win races and to go and win a championship, if it's available to him.

"We questioned that with Lando [Norris] last year, and Oscar [Piastri] too, whether they would wilt under pressure from Max [Verstappen], and they didn't.

"I think George is in a very good place."

Asked how Russell would handle any increased intra-Mercedes challenge from team-mate Kimi Antonelli, the 19-year-old Italian entering his second year of F1, Brundle added: "Remember, [Russell] grew up in Lewis Hamilton's shadow at Mercedes, and he handled that, and eventually in the final year they were team-mates, he beat Lewis clearly.

Please use Chrome browser for a more accessible video player Russell admits his two starts in Bahrain have been 'worse' than his worst-ever start in Formula 1

"So, I have no doubts about him whatsoever. They're all world-class drivers in F1, you've got to beat them somehow.

"I think George has got so much experience now despite not being 30 yet, that I don't think anything will distract him if he's got a championship-winning car."

'No clear favourite' - Brundle expects open 'big-four' battle

While Mercedes may be favourites for both titles heading into the 24-race campaign, Brundle believes they will face a challenge from all three of their established rivals on the evidence of the three winter tests.

"I see Ferrari being strong, I see both Ferrari drivers being strong," said Brundle.

"I think both McLaren drivers will be strong as well. Oscar will come back on a mission after what he learned last year; Lando, I don't think I've ever seen him yet not with that big grin on his face so far this year, he's just got that comfort now.

"The Red Bull looks really strong, and we know how Max's car control, which you'll need with these cars, will be incredible.

"So, for me, there's not a clear favourite."

Football.title: Warren: Dubois' pre-fight party 'can't happen again'
Football.content:
The pre-fight ‚Äòparty‚Äô that took place ahead of Daniel Dubois‚Äô defeat to Oleksandr Usyk ‚Äúcan‚Äôt happen again‚Äù, says promoter Frank Warren.

Dubois rematched Usyk last year, losing their undisputed heavyweight title fight by fifth round knockout.

The Briton only arrived at the venue 90 minutes before he was due to make his ringwalk and some time after Usyk had.

Dubois reached Wembley stadium late and it's been suggested that a party or gathering hosted by his father delayed and disrupted him ahead of the contest.

That will not be repeated when Dubois fights Fabio Wardley for the WBO heavyweight world championship on May 9.

Please use Chrome browser for a more accessible video player Daniel Dubois refused to shake Fabio Wardley's hand after they faced off for the first time at the launch press conference ahead of their fight in May

"That can't happen again. The good thing is they'll be in Manchester so they'll be staying in a hotel," promoter Frank Warren told Sky Sports.

"When he was late getting there, I was tearing my hair out, what I've got left. I can't be arguing with everyone when he's two hours away from the biggest fight ever but afterwards we had a sitdown and said what we had to say."

Dubois wants to put that incident behind him now. "I don't want to go on about that," he told Sky Sports.

The heavyweight did have a brief stint with a new trainer Tony Sims, before returning to coach Don Charles.

Please use Chrome browser for a more accessible video player Daniel Dubois' manager Sam Jones believes his fighter has all the attributes to cause Fabio Wardley issues and will feel power that he hasn't experienced ever before in the ring

"He's in a good place at the moment," Warren noted. "Leaving Don and then going back has been good for him that he's been elsewhere and seen he's more comfortable with Don. There's been a lot of stuff happening behind the scenes for that fight which has been well documented."

Dubois gets an immediate chance at redemption when he fights Wardley. "It's taking no steps backwards. This is the best fight for me," he said. "I'm glad he's taken it. My big chance, my big opportunity and I've got to take his 0 [unbeaten record].

"A lot has gone on behind the scenes. Now I'm going to prove them all wrong and take that belt."

He thinks Wardley is gambling on him struggling with confidence coming off a high profile loss.

But he warned: "They don't know that I'm prepared even more, better than ever.

"It's just another lesson, another milestone in my career. I have no emotions towards that. I'm looking solely towards the future.

"A perfect opponent I think, his style and the way he is, suits me perfectly," Dubois said of Wardley.

"Skills, that's what it's about, breaking him down and then taking him out. Jab, foot movement, speed and just what I do. You guys are going to be in for a treat.

"No more freezing in front of a crowd, I'm used to that now. I'm going to on top of him from the first bell.

"I'm going to do it again, win the world title and hold onto it."

Please use Chrome browser for a more accessible video player Fabio Wardley suggests Daniel Dubois' front-footed fighting style will be a good match and will suit him when the two meet in Manchester on May 9

He thinks a victory could well lead him to a showdown with Tyson Fury. "That would be massive, pull that one off again and back to Wembley," Dubois said.

"One fight at a time but I'll come through anyone. I'll be a force for anyone in that ring.

"There's a lot up for grabs."

But he added: "Lots of new fighters coming up as well. Not just Fury. New challenges, new prospects coming up and it's going to be interesting getting in the mix again.

"There's so many prospects so many names out there that. Pull this one off then the doors are wide open to make any big fight domestically or in the world."

Football.title: Liverpool‚Äôs title win last season fuelled by Premier League‚Äôs highest wage bill
Football.content:
Liverpool had the highest wage bill in the Premier League when winning their 20th league title last season, the club‚Äôs latest set of accounts have revealed.

Liverpool‚Äôs wage bill increased by ¬£42m to ¬£428m in the year ending 31 May 2025, when a Premier League title triumph in Arne Slot‚Äôs debut season as head coach and a return to the Champions League increased revenue to a record ¬£703m. The club‚Äôs wages-to-revenue ratio stood at a healthy 61%. It was the biggest wage bill in the division, ahead of Manchester City on ¬£408m.

Commercial revenue increased by ¬£15m to ¬£323m and matchday revenue by ¬£14m to ¬£116m. The figures contributed to an increase of ¬£89m in revenue for the highest-ranked Premier League club in the Deloitte Football Money League. But the rise in wages, which pushed administrative costs up by ¬£57m to ¬£657m, resulted in a relatively modest post-tax profit of ¬£8m. Liverpool had a ¬£57m loss in 2023-24 after failing to qualify for the Champions League.

‚ÄúWe make no secret of our desire to run and operate a financially sustainable club, to grow revenue streams, and to do all we can off the pitch to help bring more success on it,‚Äù said Liverpool‚Äôs chief financial officer, Jenny Beacham. ‚ÄúThe 2024-25 season is a great example of how this can work, with record revenues alongside the men‚Äôs team winning our 20th league title.

‚ÄúThe club does face significant cost challenges, including rises in administrative, staffing and operational costs, alongside the need for us to compete at the highest level of the game, across our men and women‚Äôs teams.‚Äù

Liverpool‚Äôs latest set of published accounts do not include last summer‚Äôs record spend of almost ¬£450m on new players, including the British record signing of Alexander Isak for ¬£125m from Newcastle. Slot said recently that failure to qualify for the Champions League would be unacceptable for Liverpool this season and the competition ‚Äúdoes have an enormous impact on the way this club is run‚Äù.

Football.title: Nottingham Forest turn to former Spurs head of medicine after team‚Äôs injury struggles
Football.content:
Nottingham Forest have appointed a new director of performance, Tottenham‚Äôs former head of medicine and sports science Geoff Scott, amid concerns that injury problems have exacerbated their struggle to avoid relegation.

Scott spent 20 years at Tottenham until leaving two years ago after a clash with the then manager, Ange Postecoglou, who was in charge of Forest for eight matches this season.

V√≠tor Pereira was this month appointed Forest‚Äôs fourth manager of a turbulent campaign, and his side are two points above the bottom three before Sunday‚Äôs trip to Brighton.

Forest‚Äôs struggles have not been helped by injuries, with 19 players ruled out at some stage, one of the worst records in the Premier League. Only Tottenham, Chelsea and Arsenal have had more injuries, and those clubs have deeper squads.

Scott will take charge of an overhauled medical department, with the existing head of medical, Dr Prithish Narayan, understood to be leaving to return to work for the NHS.

Scott left Tottenham at the start of last season as part of a major restructure of Postecoglou‚Äôs backroom team, which led to the appointment of Adam Brett from Brighton as Spurs‚Äô director of performance services. It was widely reported at the time that Scott had clashed with Postecoglou over the players‚Äô workload and management of their recovery, with Tottenham declining to comment.

Tottenham‚Äôs squad has been devastated by injuries for the last two seasons under Postecoglou and Thomas Frank, with the club experiencing 41 injuries last season leading to 1,553 days out, the second-highest total in the Premier League after Brighton.

Football.title: Will Aston Villa hold on to their place in the Champions League?
Football.content:
Two months ago, Aston Villa were just three points off top spot in the Premier League. They were on a run of 12 wins in 14 games that included victories against Manchester City and Arsenal. Their run of eight consecutive wins in the league was their best since they won 10 in a row in 1910. You wouldn‚Äôt have blamed Villa fans for daring to dream about lifting their first league title since 1981.

But success breeds expectation, and expectation carries its own cruel weight. Arsenal tore Villa apart in a 4-1 win in late December and victories have been hard to come by in the new year ‚Äì they have only won three of their last nine league games. Liverpool, Manchester United and Chelsea are still below them in the table but the gap is narrowing. With games against United and Chelsea coming in March, the top-three spot Villa have occupied since they beat Wolves in late November suddenly looks in jeopardy. So does their place in the Champions League next season.

They salvaged a point against Leeds on Saturday courtesy of a scrambled 88th-minute finish from Tammy Abraham, but the 1-1 draw at Villa Park did little to disguise the deeper issues. Unai Emery‚Äôs side looked anxious and lacked inspiration for long periods of the game. A slow start left them chasing the game and, not for the first time this season, they relied on a set-piece goal to bail them out of trouble. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a good point,‚Äù said a clearly relieved Emery. Daniel Farke‚Äôs reaction was telling. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs crazy that you can come here as a newly promoted side ‚Äì to one of the title contenders, one of the best teams in this country and in Europe ‚Äì and you are slightly disappointed with just one point.‚Äù

The tension from the fans in Villa Park mirrored the hesitancy on the pitch ‚Äì a rarity in what has been one of Europe‚Äôs most difficult venues to visit in recent years. Villa lost just one home game in the league last season and were on a run of eight straight wins at Villa Park this season before their current slump. And yet they were just minutes away from their fourth defeat in their last six home games in all competitions. For a side that has thrived on controlled possession, high-quality chance creation and adaptability, they looked one-dimensional and mistake-prone.

Villa are lacking a creative pulse and their strikers are suffering. They have scored just one goal from open play in their last five matches. Injuries have had a large part to play in this. Three of their first-choice midfielders ‚Äì Boubacar Kamara, Youri Tielemans and John McGinn ‚Äì are out injured.

Tielemans and McGinn have set up 50 chances for teammates this season (only Morgan Rogers has been more creative) so it‚Äôs no surprise to see Villa struggle for goals. Without the physicality and control of their absent midfielders, Villa‚Äôs buildup play has been fractured and mistakes have crept in. Their replacements, Douglas Luiz and Amadou Onana, were injured earlier in the season and lack the match fitness required to complete games.

View image in fullscreen Aston Villa have missed John McGinn, their captain, during his injury layoff. Photograph: Martin Rickett/PA

The good news for Villa fans is that they have battled back from similar setbacks in the recent past. They failed to score a goal or win a point from their first four league matches this season yet were fighting for the title by Christmas.

And they had to show plenty of character the last time they qualified for the Champions League, in the 2023‚Äì24 season. They were challenging for the title at Christmas, having lost just two of their first 18 games. But they struggled in the second half of the campaign, lost seven matches and found them themselves grinding out results. That team held on and finished fourth, booking their place in Europe‚Äôs top competition for the first time since the 1982-83 season.

Villa are showing similar grit this season. After Abraham‚Äôs last-gasp equaliser against Leeds, Villa have won 19 points from losing positions ‚Äì more than any other side in the division. They also have the third best defensive record, having conceded just 28 goals in 27 games. And they have one of the most experienced and shrewdest managers in Europe.

It‚Äôs also worth remembering that the Premier League is unusually competitive this season. The longest current winning streak in the league is just three matches (Manchester City). All of the top teams ‚Äì even leaders Arsenal ‚Äì have gone through periods when they have dug in. Villa‚Äôs resilience could prove decisive. Their recent draws against Crystal Palace, Bournemouth and Leeds might feel like missed opportunities, but those points may prove crucial come May.

March will be a season-defining month for Villa. Their recent form is patchy and their performances have been far from eye-catching. Fluidity in possession has given way to forced passes, and dominance has often been replaced by moments of desperation. But there remains a steel to this side that cannot be ignored. And, crucially given their upcoming games against their fellow Champions League chasers, they have a nice habit of beating the top sides. They have already beaten Arsenal, Manchester City, Manchester United and Chelsea in the league this season. There are plenty of reasons to go into the run-in with optimism.

This is an article by WhoScored

Football.content:
1 Emery seeks to end Wolves duck

Unai Emery has seen most things in this game but he has never won at Wolves. In three and a half years at Villa, he has lost two and drawn one of his three games at Molineux. Twelve months ago they lost this fixture 2-0 and this week Emery shared his poor record to stress the difficulty of the challenge facing his side, particularly given they have won just one of their past five matches in all competitions. Emery even mentioned his visit to Wolverhampton with Arsenal in 2019, when his team trailed 3-0 at half-time and lost 3-1. For Emery, there is no better time to break his duck, with the schedule dictating that Villa could move nine points clear of fifth-placed Chelsea, who visit Villa on Wednesday, before Liam Rosenior‚Äôs side travel to Arsenal on Sunday. Victory would enhance Villa‚Äôs chances of returning to the Champions League but also pile pressure on direct rivals. Ben Fisher

Wolves v Aston Villa, Friday 8pm (all kick-offs GMT)

2 Xhaka‚Äôs return can lift Black Cats

These teams are heading in opposite directions: Bournemouth are unbeaten in seven, while Sunderland have won twice in the same period and lost their past three games. One key reason for the Black Cats‚Äô slide is that their captain, Granit Xhaka, missed four games through injury, only returning to the bench in the most recent defeat, to Fulham. The central midfielder has been instrumental in helping R√©gis Le Bris‚Äôs side to the verge of safety and they have lacked his experience and influence in recent weeks. He managed half an hour on Sunday and it feels necessary to reinstate him to the starting lineup. Considering how well Bournemouth are playing, Sunderland will need a disruptor to not let them settle and allow his own side to rediscover the rhythm that‚Äôs made them a surprise package this season. Will Unwin

Bournemouth v Sunderland, Saturday 12.30pm

View image in fullscreen Back in business: Granit Xhaka looks set to give Sunderland a timely boost. Photograph: Owen Humphreys/PA

3 A first Burnley start for Ward-Prowse?

If there was one thing James Ward-Prowse can do even when not 100% match fit, it is deliver a superb set piece. The former England midfielder is yet to start in the Premier League since joining from West Ham in January but showed his worth in the draw at Chelsea, where it was his corner that landed perfectly on Zian Flemming‚Äôs head to earn a late point. The Clarets have not looked particularly dangerous from set pieces this season and having Ward-Prowse among their limited weaponry will be advantageous in the final stages of the season, even if the club are heading for relegation. It feels vital that Scott Parker should start him at the weekend, a reward for his cameo at Stamford Bridge, where he was also the man fouled for Wesley Fofana‚Äôs second booking, having beaten the Chelsea man to the ball. Ward-Prowse may have drifted into the shadows in recent years but he has plenty to offer still. WU

Burnley v Brentford, Saturday 3pm

4 Liverpool launch sign language initiative

A welcome initiative is taking place before Liverpool‚Äôs game against West Ham, designated the club‚Äôs ‚ÄúRed Together‚Äù match. According to research conducted by Liverpool‚Äôs commercial partner Carlsberg, 81% of deaf and hard-of-hearing fans feel unable to participate in matchday chants with 74% of those affected feeling disconnected from the stadium atmosphere. In response, and in conjunction with the British Deaf Association, Liverpool fans are being asked to perform ‚ÄúYou‚Äôll Never Walk Alone‚Äù in British Sign Language (BSL) as they sing the club‚Äôs anthem before kick-off. BSL interpreters will be in operation at every subsequent home match and bar staff at Anfield are being trained in basic sign language to help combat the exclusion that deaf and hard-of-hearing fans experience on a matchday. Anyone wishing to join in can find a useful video guide here. Andy Hunter

Liverpool v West Ham, Saturday 3pm

View image in fullscreen Liverpool fans sing You‚Äôll Never Walk Alone before kick-off at Anfield. Photograph: Lewis Storey/Getty Images

5 Centre stage for Gordon against old club

Newcastle may be in the last 16 of the Champions League but they are also 11th in the Premier League, two places and one point behind Saturday‚Äôs visitors to St James‚Äô Park, Everton. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôve raised our game at times in the Champions League, there‚Äôs no denying that,‚Äù says Eddie Howe. ‚ÄúBut we want to get into Europe every season and we‚Äôre desperate to get our Premier League form back on track. We‚Äôve been inconsistent and we need to find a remedy.‚Äù With Manchester United (fourth and 12 points ahead of Howe‚Äôs team) visiting Tyneside on Wednesday night these two impending home league fixtures offer Newcastle an ideal opportunity to revive their latterly receding top-six ambitions. On Saturday much may depend on Anthony Gordon‚Äôs performance against his former club. Can Howe‚Äôs left-winger turned centre-forward outwit his old teammate Jordan Pickford in the visiting goal? As a former Sunderland goalkeeper, Pickford always relishes clean sheets kept at St James‚Äô and will be anxious to avenge Everton‚Äôs 4-1 league defeat on Merseyside in November. Louise Taylor

Newcastle v Everton, Saturday 3pm

6 Farke and Guardiola‚Äôs pals act

Back in November, Leeds were 2-0 down at Manchester City at half-time in a Premier League match many pundits predicted might be Daniel Farke‚Äôs last in charge. By full time the score was 3-2 to City. An interval switch to a back three and the introduction of Dominic Calvert-Lewin had prompted a Leeds revival. The Elland Road board offered Farke the benefit of the doubt and his team continue to be much improved. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre growing into the Premier League,‚Äù said the German, who welcomes his good friend Pep Guardiola to West Yorkshire on Saturday. ‚ÄúBehind the scenes we have a pretty close relationship,‚Äù explained Farke. ‚ÄúPep‚Äôs the best manager in the world; he always evolves and develops ahead of the wave. He played false 9s and inverted full-backs before anyone had heard of them.‚Äù With relegation a lingering worry, Farke will temporarily forget his bond with Guardiola as he aims to collect at least four points from home games against title-chasing City and Tuesday‚Äôs visitors, Sunderland. Louise Taylor

Leeds v Manchester City, Saturday 5.30pm

View image in fullscreen Daniel Farke will be hoping for more celebration as Manchester City come to Elland Road. Photograph: Bruce Rollinson/PA

7 H√ºrzeler seeks home approval from fans

Given supporters were calling for his head after their insipid defeat by Crystal Palace the last time Brighton played at home, Fabian H√ºrzeler will be relieved that last week‚Äôs victory at Brentford has eased some concerns over relegation. Struggling Nottingham Forest‚Äôs visit to the south coast on Sunday still promises to be another anxious afternoon given another defeat would certainly not go down well with supporters. H√ºrzeler‚Äôs position is set to be reviewed at the end of the season and he is convinced they are back on the right track after a run of six games without a win. Brighton will need their fans to get behind them. ‚ÄúIf we keep doing the performance we‚Äôve shown in recent weeks, we are 100% convinced that we will get the results we deserve,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúSo it‚Äôs really about focusing on the performances, focusing on the principles, focusing on bringing good energy on the pitch, focusing on getting the crowd involved, the crowd behind us.‚Äù Ed Aarons

Brighton v Nottingham Forest, Sunday 2pm

8 Tudor should ditch three at the back

What we found out on Igor Tudor‚Äôs debut as Tottenham head coach is that he really wants to play three at the back despite not possessing the personnel to do so. Jo√£o Palhinha was the unfortunate victim of the Croat‚Äôs in-box thinking, based on what has worked for him previously at the various clubs who have employed and ‚Äì quite quickly ‚Äì sacked him. Things need to change for Spurs and, considering Tudor‚Äôs only senior outfield players in the north London derby debacle were Richarlison, Dominic Solanke and Mathys Tel, it would make more sense to reconfigure the formation to avoid having a central midfielder in defence and to incorporate some of his experienced Premier League forwards. Tudor is, in theory, only in England for a short time and he needs to show future employers that he is capable of working with what he is given and he cannot face another desperate capital derby performance. WU

Fulham v Tottenham, Sunday 2pm

View image in fullscreen Jo√£o Palhinha (left) battles with Leandro Trossard during an uncomfortable afternoon in the north London derby. Photograph: Ian Walton/AP

9 Amad to make way for Sesko?

For Michael Carrick to find a fall guy for Benjamin Sesko, who is seeking a first start under him, the interim manager need look no further than Amad Diallo. The Ivorian has hardly been poor in Manchester United‚Äôs strong run in which they have acquired 16 points from Carrick‚Äôs six games but he last scored for United against Bournemouth in mid-December and was taken off after 58 minutes of Monday‚Äôs 1-0 win at Everton. Sesko replaced the 23-year-old and netted the 71st-minute winner, for a third goal in four games after coming off the bench. So do not be surprised if Sesko is chosen at No 9, Bryan Mbeumo shifts from there to the right wing, and Matheus Cunha continues on the left. Jamie Jackson

Manchester United v Crystal Palace, Sunday 2pm

10 Chelsea need to keep their heads

Thomas Tuchel was still in charge the last time Chelsea managed to overcome Arsenal. Since recording a 2-0 away win in August 2021, the west London side have lost seven of their last 10 meetings in all competitions as the balance of power in the capital has swung towards Mikel Arteta‚Äôs side. Despite winning both legs of the Carabao Cup semi-final ‚Äì the only defeats Liam Rosenior has suffered since taking over from Enzo Maresca in January ‚Äì Arsenal will be wary of opponents who held them to a draw at Stamford Bridge in November with 10 men for more than 50 minutes after the dismissal of Mois√©s Caicedo. Wesley Fofana‚Äôs red card cost them against Burnley last week and Chelsea will need to maintain their discipline if they are to stand a chance of winning at the Emirates. EA

Football.title: Ruben Amorim sacking will cost Manchester United up to ¬£15.9m
Football.content:
Manchester United sacking Ruben Amorim could end up costing the club almost ¬£16m. Amorim‚Äôs 14-month reign ended on 5 January after his public attack on United‚Äôs hierarchy, with his five coaches also leaving Old Trafford.

A filing to the New York Stock Exchange revealed the potential payments to Amorim and his staff, a day after the club confirmed they had made a ¬£32.6m profit in their second-quarter results to 31 December 2025.

United listed it as an ‚Äúevent that occurred after the reporting period‚Äù, and said: ‚ÄúA charge of ¬£6.3m for the write off of related intangible assets and a provision of ¬£15.9m, representing the maximum potential amount of future settlement payments, will be recognised in the statement of profit or (loss) during the second half of the year ending 30 June 2026.‚Äù

It has been reported the maximum amount of ¬£15.9m is dependent on certain factors, such as Amorim not getting a new job within a specific timeframe.

The accounts showed United have also paid Sporting ¬£6.3m, which is what they owed the Portuguese club in compensation for hiring Amorim. United said in a November 2024 filing they were paying Sporting ¬£10m to hire Amorim to replace Erik ten Hag, whose exit was costing ¬£10.4m.

The combined changes around Amorim‚Äôs appointment could cost United ¬£36.3m. Amorim won 25 of his 63 games, finishing 15th in the Premier League, United‚Äôs worst performance since being relegated from the top flight in 1973-74.

United were sixth in the Premier League when Amorim was dismissed, having had a major falling out with the director of football, Jason Wilcox, days before his final game at Leeds.

They have boosted their hopes of Champions League football next season under Michael Carrick, climbing to fourth with five wins and a draw.

Football.title: Hudson-Odoi sends Nottingham Forest into last 16 despite fright by Fenerbahce
Football.content:
For 67 minutes, Nottingham Forest were at risk of matching an unwanted record. At that point Fenerbahce were 2-0 up and full of belief that they could achieve the miracle their head coach, Domenico Tedesco, had been manifesting since their 3-0 first-leg defeat in Istanbul.

Only one team in the history of European club competitions have lost the first leg of a tie by a three-goal margin at home and advanced in the second. Up in the directors‚Äô box, Evangelos Marinakis, more than an interested party on that occasion, presumably had flashbacks of Olympiakos suffering a 4-1 home defeat by Maccabi Tel Aviv in the Conference League two years ago, only to triumph 6-1 in Serbia in the second leg.

Kerem Akturkoglu scored twice to fuel Fenerbahce‚Äôs hopes, his second from the penalty spot almost immediately after the half-time restart, but the Forest substitute Callum Hudson-Odoi struck midway through the second half to extinguish the visitors‚Äô dreams. Forest will learn on Friday whether they will face Midtjylland or Real Betis, both of whom they played in the league phase and could not beat, in the last 16. Fenerbahce‚Äôs hopes of reaching the Europa League showpiece in May, across town in Besiktas Stadium, are over.

The way this game was set up, an early Fenerbahce goal was always going to shift the dynamic of the tie and the Turkish side got one when Akturkoglu applied the finishing touch to a counterattack. V√≠tor Pereira acknowledged the worst mistake Forest could make was to assume their place in the last 16 was secure and his much-changed side were disjointed and sloppy. ‚ÄúIt was a thriller ‚Äì with suspense,‚Äù Pereira said. ‚ÄúWe had to suffer.‚Äù

Lille bounced back from losing the first leg to win 2-0 at Red Star Belgrade thanks to goals from Olivier Giroud and, in extra time, Nathan Ngoy, and will provide the other potential opposition for Villa or Lyon in Friday's draw. Robbie Keane's Ferencvaros side also overturned a one-goal first-leg deficit to win 2-0 at home and knock out Ludogorets Razgrad. First-half goals from Gabi Kanichowsky and Kristoffer Zachariassen put the Hungarian side into the next round, where they will face Porto or Braga, one of which Stuttgart will also face despite losing 1-0 at home to Celtic. Luke McCowan's goal after 28 seconds was the Europa League's fastest in 10 years but the hosts prevailed 4-2 on aggregate. Panathinaikos, who played the second half of extra time with 10 men after Javi Hern√°ndez was sent off, beat Viktoria Plzen 4-3 on penalties after a 1-1 draw in the second leg made it 3-3 on aggregate. Andreas Tetteh put the visitors ahead early but Karel Spacil equalised for Plzen and in the shootout Milos Pantovic scored the decisive spot-kick with Midtjylland or Real Betis awaiting in the last 16. Nottingham Forest, who beat Fenerbahce on aggregate, are also potential opponents for Midtjylland or Betis. Bologna beat 10-man Brann 1-0 on the night and 2-0 on aggregate to set up last-16 tie with either Roma or Freiburg, who could also face Genk. The Belgians survived a fightback from Dinamo Zagreb who, having scored three times to make it 3-1 on the night and 4-4 on aggregate then had Luka Stojkovic sent off in extra time either side of the home side scoring twice. In the Conference League, Fiorentina needed extra time to prevail after throwing away a 3-0 lead from the first leg at Poland's Jagiellonia Bialystok. Bartosz Mazurek had led the comeback with a hat-trick, but substitutes Nicol√≤ Fagioli and an own goal in extra time proved enough for the Italian team despite Jagiellonia winning 4-2 on the night ‚Äì Fiorentina won 5-4 on aggregate.
